questions.question: What is Inheritance in OOP?

options.text: Copying and pasting code between files
Creating a new class based on an existing class
A way to delete a class

questions.explanation: Inheritance allows a child class to acquire the properties and behaviors of a parent class.

questions.question: How do you define a class 'Child' that inherits from 'Parent'?
questions.explanation: In Python, inheritance is indicated by putting the parent class name in parentheses after the child class name.

questions.question: What does the 'super()' function do?

options.text: Accesses methods from the parent class

questions.explanation: 'super()' returns a temporary object of the parent class, allowing you to call its methods.

questions.question: What is 'Method Overriding'?

options.text: Deleting a method from a class
Calling a method too many times
Providing a new implementation of a parent's method in a child class

questions.explanation: Overriding allows a child class to change how a specific task is performed while keeping the same method name.
